title: Chocolate
surface: Xiao Ming's younger brother had a pet hamster. One day, the hamster died. The younger brother was very sad, so his mother rewarded him with a piece of chocolate the size of the hamster. A short time later, Xiao Ming died. Why?
bottom: Because his hamster died, his mother gave him a piece of chocolate the size of the hamster. The younger brother thought that whatever died, he would get a piece of chocolate of the same size. So, he killed Xiao Ming, thinking he would get a piece of chocolate the size of Xiao Ming.
tips: The younger brother misunderstood the reason for getting the chocolate.
The size of the chocolate was related to the size of the deceased.
The younger brother expected to get a bigger piece of chocolate.
Xiao Ming's death is related to his younger brother.
The younger brother killed Xiao Ming to get chocolate.
The younger brother believed that death could be exchanged for a correspondingly sized chocolate.

title: The Performance
surface: A boy greatly admired his father. One day, he killed his mother and said something to his father. After hearing it, the father committed suicide.
bottom: The boy's father was a magician who often performed a trick where he would cut a person's body and then magically put it back together. The boy believed it was real. One day, when his father was not home, he tried this trick on his mother. Of course, the boy didn't know magic and actually cut his mother into pieces. When his father returned, the boy asked him to put his mother back together. Unable to face the gruesome scene and his son's innocent demeanor, the father, in despair and collapse, committed suicide.
tips: The boy's father is a magician.
The father performed a magic trick involving cutting a person.
The boy mistakenly believed his father's magic was real.
The boy tried to imitate his father's magic trick.
The boy used the 'magic trick' on his mother.
The boy asked his father to restore his mother.
The father committed suicide due to the horrific reality and his son's ignorance.

title: The Cure
surface: He decided to pay for his financially struggling mother's medical treatment, but she adamantly refused.
bottom: His mother, who had gone bankrupt, suffered from kidney failure and needed a kidney transplant. He decided to donate one of his own kidneys to her. When his mother found out, she adamantly refused the offer because, unbeknownst to him, one of his kidneys had been sold by his mother when he was a child to cover her business debts.
tips: The mother suffers from kidney failure.
The treatment requires a kidney transplant.
The son offered to donate his own kidney.
The mother refused because of the son's special physical condition.
The son actually only has one kidney.
The son lost a kidney when he was a child.
The mother had sold her son's kidney in the past.

title: Jumping from the Train
surface: A person took a train to a neighboring town for medical treatment. After the treatment, he was completely cured. On the way back, as the train passed through a tunnel, the person jumped off the train and committed suicide.
bottom: His illness was an eye condition; he was completely blind. After the treatment, his sight was restored. When the train went through the tunnel, the sudden darkness made him think he had gone blind again, so he had a mental breakdown and committed suicide.
tips: The person's illness was an eye condition.
The treatment was successful, and he regained his sight.
The train entered a dark tunnel.
The darkness in the tunnel caused him to misunderstand.
He thought he had gone blind again.
He was in despair, believing his old illness had returned.
He committed suicide because he couldn't bear the thought of being blind again.

title: The Water Weeds
surface: A man was walking by a river with his girlfriend when she suddenly fell in. The man quickly jumped into the water to find her but couldn't. He left heartbroken. Years later, he revisited the place and saw an old man fishing. The fish the old man caught had no water weeds on them. He asked the old man why the fish weren't covered in weeds. The old man said, 'Don't you know? This river has never had any water weeds.' Upon hearing this, the man suddenly jumped into the river and committed suicide.
bottom: The man had once grabbed his girlfriend's hair but thought it was water weeds and let go. His girlfriend essentially died at his hands.
tips: The man had grabbed something while trying to save his girlfriend.
At the time, he mistook what he grabbed for water weeds.
Because of this misunderstanding, he let go.
He had actually grabbed his girlfriend's hair.
This river has no water weeds at all.
The old man's words revealed the fact that there were no weeds in the river.
The man realized he had let go of his girlfriend.
He understood that his girlfriend's death was related to him letting go.
The man committed suicide out of intense guilt.

title: A Pile of Wood Shavings
surface: There were two dwarfs in a circus. The blind dwarf was shorter than the other. The circus only needed one dwarf, and of course, the shorter the better. The two dwarfs decided to have a contest to see who was shorter; the taller one would commit suicide. However, the day before the scheduled contest, the blind dwarf, the shorter one, had already committed suicide at home. In his house, only wooden furniture and a pile of wood shavings were found.
bottom: The other dwarf had shortened the blind dwarf's cane. As a result, the blind dwarf thought he had suddenly grown taller.
tips: The blind dwarf's suicide was based on a misjudgment.
The other dwarf cheated to win the competition.
The wood shavings on the floor did not come from the furniture.
The wood shavings were related to the blind dwarf's walking aid.
The blind dwarf's cane had been altered by someone.
The length of the cane had been shortened.
The blind dwarf mistakenly believed he had become relatively taller.
He committed suicide because he thought he had lost the height comparison.

title: The Nanny
surface: A woman was working as a nanny in another city. One day, her husband came to visit her and looked around the nanny's room where she lived. The next day, the husband came to pick up his wallet, which he had left in her room, without notifying her. The woman blamed her husband, and he slapped her and divorced her.
bottom: The man's wife went to the city to work as a nanny. The man heard rumors that his wife was having an affair with her employer. Unwilling to believe it, he went to visit her. The wife said she lived in a separate nanny's room and chided him for coming unannounced. The man felt he had been overthinking and, too proud to apologize, left 520 yuan (a number symbolizing 'I love you' in Chinese) on her pillow. He thought she would like the popular romantic gesture. That night, he eagerly waited for her to find the surprise, but heard nothing. Unconvinced, he called and asked if she was sleeping in her room. After getting an affirmative answer, he hung up, went back to the room, found the money untouched, and confirmed she had not slept in her own room.
tips: The husband suspected his wife was having an affair with her employer.
The husband left money on the pillow during his first visit.
The amount of money left was 520 yuan.
The husband left the money to test his wife.
The wife never touched the money on the pillow.
The untouched money proved the wife did not sleep in the nanny's room that night.
The wife lied to her husband about where she slept.
The husband thus confirmed his wife was lying or cheating.
The divorce was because the husband discovered his wife's lie.

title: Snow
surface: Xiao Ming, a northerner, was walking through a tall, unfinished building complex one day when he suddenly died. When the police found him, they discovered no murder weapon.
bottom: Xiao Ming was walking in the winter. An icicle from above fell and pierced through his chest, killing him. Months later, when the police found him, the temperature had risen, and the ice had melted.
tips: Xiao Ming's death occurred in winter.
The fatal object fell from a high place.
The 'murder weapon' was formed from ice (an icicle).
Xiao Ming was killed by being impaled by an icicle.
The body was discovered several months after death.
The weather had warmed up by the time the body was found.
The icicle that caused the death had already melted and disappeared.
Therefore, the police found no 'murder weapon'.

title: Fear and Despair
surface: A man lit a match in the darkness and died of fear and despair.
bottom: The man was a prisoner. To escape, he bribed a guard. They agreed that the next time a prisoner died, he would hide in the coffin with the body to get past inspection and be transported out of the prison. The guard would then secretly dig him up after the burial. Finally, the day came when someone died. He didn't care who it was and quickly hid in the coffin. After the coffin was buried, the prisoner lit a match. He then saw that the corpse next to him was the very guard he had bribed! Of course, no one would be coming to dig him out.
tips: The man was a prisoner.
He was attempting to escape from prison at the time.
His escape plan involved hiding in a coffin.
He had made a deal with a prison guard.
The guard was supposed to dig him out afterward.
He lit the match to see inside the coffin.
There was another body in the coffin.
He recognized the identity of the corpse.
The corpse was the guard he had bribed.
He realized he would be buried alive.
His death was caused by the despair of being trapped and his plan failing.

title: The Sharp Object
surface: Classmates were celebrating Xiao Ming's birthday. In full view of everyone, Xiao Ming was fatally stabbed by a sharp object. Please deduce.
bottom: Some cakes require internal supports like bamboo skewers or similar sharp objects for their shape. The classmate who ordered the cake got one with a unique design to surprise Xiao Ming, which contained such supports. However, some other classmates didn't know this. After singing the birthday song, they pushed Xiao Ming's head into the cake, and the sharp object pierced his skull.
tips: The fatal 'sharp object' was part of the birthday cake.
The cake had a special shape and contained internal supports.
The cake had hidden bamboo skewers or other sharp objects inside.
These sharp objects were used to hold the cake's shape.
Not all classmates knew about the sharp objects inside the cake.
Xiao Ming's death was related to a birthday celebration prank.
The classmates pushed Xiao Ming's head into the cake.
The sharp object inside the cake pierced Xiao Ming's head.
This was an accidental death caused by a birthday prank.

title: Meeting the Parents
surface: My boyfriend and I are alumni; he's three years older and about to graduate. I felt an instant connection with him, love at first sight. We agreed to get married as soon as I reached the legal age. With the National Day holiday approaching, my boyfriend suggested I stay instead of going home and come meet his parents. I happily agreed. However, when his parents saw my face, they were horrified and strongly opposed our relationship. Why?
bottom: This was during the era of reform, opening-up, and the one-child policy. I was an 'excess' child. To keep their jobs, my parents sent me to be raised by distant relatives in the countryside after I was born, and my surname was changed. My parents always provided financial support to the relatives. They were happy to learn I got into a university here and were nearing retirement. They were considering contacting me to bring me back into the family, but who knew that we, biological siblings, had fallen in love? A human tragedy.
tips: The girl was not raised by her biological parents.
She was fostered or sent away.
This is related to the one-child policy of that time.
The boyfriend's parents know the girl.
The boyfriend's parents are the girl's biological parents.
The parents recognized her by her appearance.
The girl and her boyfriend are related by blood.
They are biological siblings.
The girl's current surname is not her original one.

title: Knock at Midnight
surface: A person lived in a small cabin on a mountaintop. In the middle of the night, he heard a knock on the door, but when he opened it, no one was there, so he went back to sleep. The next day, a dead body was found at the foot of the mountain, and the police came and took the person from the mountaintop away.
bottom: The cabin on the mountaintop was right at the edge of a cliff. The person below had just managed to climb up and was knocking on the door for help. When the door was opened, he was pushed off the cliff again.
tips: The cabin is built on the edge of a cliff.
The area just outside the cabin door is a cliff.
The person knocking had climbed up from the bottom of the cliff.
The knocker was seeking help.
The person who opened the door saw no one.
The act of opening the door caused the knocker to fall.
The body at the foot of the mountain was the person who had knocked.
This was an accidental death caused by opening the door.

title: The Bride
surface: The bride, in her white gown, walked slowly down the red carpet. When it was finally time to exchange rings... she suddenly died.
bottom: The bride's wedding dress was bought from a second-hand store. The person who sold the dress to the store was a mortician. He stole clothes from the deceased to sell, making a tidy profit. However, he didn't realize that this wedding dress was saturated with a high concentration of preservatives, which would cause the person wearing it to die as the chemicals seeped into their skin.
tips: The bride's wedding dress was second-hand.
The dress had previously been in contact with a corpse.
The dress had chemical residues on it.
This chemical was a preservative.
The bride died from dermal absorption.
The origin of the wedding dress is related to the funeral industry.
The person who sold the dress stole clothes from the dead.
The concentration of the preservative was high enough to be lethal.

title: Winter Break Homework
surface: I've been swamped trying to finish my winter break homework these past two days. Luckily, I finished it on the day school started. This morning, before my mom woke up, I went to school to register. But when I got to school, I went crazy.
bottom: I'm a high school senior from a single-parent family. In the final six months of the sprint, my mom suddenly fell seriously ill. Thankfully, it was winter break, so I could take care of her. School starts tomorrow. After putting my mom to sleep, I continued with my homework. Before I knew it, it was dawn. To let my mom sleep a little longer, I tiptoed out of the house. At school, when I opened my homework, I found a piece of paper inside. Looking closely, it was a suicide note from my mom. In the note, she said that I could take care of myself even without her. But if I were all alone, what's the point of getting into a good university?
tips: 'I' come from a single-parent family.
My mother is seriously ill.
'I' had to take care of my mother during the winter break.
'I' found something unusual when I opened my homework at school.
There was a piece of paper tucked inside the homework.
The note was written by my mother.
The piece of paper was my mother's suicide note.
My mother believed 'I' could live independently.
The content of the suicide note caused 'my' mental breakdown.

title: Loyal Dog
surface: Xiao Qiang raised a loyal dog. One day, he took the dog out on the street, and Xiao Qiang died.
bottom: Xiao Qiang had a heart condition. That day, he suddenly collapsed in the street due to a heart attack. The loyal dog kept strangers from approaching Xiao Qiang, and in the end, no one could help him, leading to his death.
tips: Xiao Qiang had a serious heart condition
He suddenly suffered a heart attack on the street
The loyal dog prevented others from approaching him
The dog blocked emergency help
Loyalty led to the owner's death

title: Injury
surface: He lay on the grass, holding a jacket soaked in blood.
bottom: A thief stole from his neighbor. To create the appearance of not being a familiar person, he used the jacket to break a window but cut his arm on the broken glass, leaving a large wound. When his neighbor found him following the blood trail on the grass, he had already bled to death. The neighbor thought the blood was left by the person who harmed him, but in reality, he had died from blood loss, and the blood trail was his own.
tips: The man broke a window to steal from his neighbor
The jacket was used to break the window but cut his arm
He bled to death from the wound
The neighbor followed the blood trail to find him
The blood trail was left by the man himself

surface: A young child at the kindergarten always counts '1, 2, 3, 7,' always skipping '4, 5, 6.' When I corrected her, she said her mom taught her that way. I was confused, so I suggested visiting her home. After the visit, I too started saying '1, 2, 3, 7.'
bottom: I am a preschool teacher, and when teaching the children, I noticed one child always counted wrong. Others counted '1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,' but she counted '1, 2, 3, 7.' When I taught her the correct way, she said that her mother taught her '1, 2, 3, 7.' I was curious, so I suggested visiting her home. She took me to a hospital. It turned out her mother had heart disease and didn’t have long to live. Her daughter’s birthday was in July, and in March, her mother had told her this story so they could enjoy one last birthday together. I was deeply moved and, like her mother, told her '3, 7.'
tips: The child's counting was not actually wrong
The mother’s teaching was not random
The child’s mother suffered from a serious illness
The number 7 represents an important month
This was a mother’s kind lie

title: High Heels
surface: A woman went to a shoe store and bought a pair of red high heels. These heels predicted her death that night.
bottom: The woman was an acrobat. That day, she bought a pair of red high heels. She wore them for a performance that evening. Because the heels were a few centimeters higher than usual, during the performance, her male partner accidentally threw a knife, which struck her in the head.
tips: The woman was an acrobat
She bought a new pair of high heels
The new heels were a few centimeters higher than usual
The heel height led to a partner's mistake
The flying knife struck her in the head

title: Friend’s Sacrifice
surface: I am a mermaid, and I had a good human friend. The legend says that eating my flesh grants immortality. That day, my friend ate a piece of my flesh. My friend died, and I cried.
bottom: The mermaid and her friend lived together in a village. A merchant came to buy mermaid flesh, but the friend ate a piece of it, and immediately went mad and jumped into the river. The legend of immortality from eating mermaid flesh was never believed again. The mermaid lived quietly, only she knew that after her friend ate the flesh, he said 'Take care' and jumped into the river to die.

The legend said eating mermaid flesh grants immortality
The friend ate the mermaid’s flesh and died
After eating the flesh, the friend jumped into the river to commit suicide
The friend died to protect the mermaid

title: Library Book Borrowing
surface: A woman went to the library to borrow a book, and when she opened it, she cried.
bottom: The woman was the author of the book. She had inserted 100 yuan into the book and donated it to the library. Years later, she came back to borrow the book, and the money was still there, showing that no one had ever read her book.

She placed money in the book as a donation
The money had never been touched over the years

title: Lighthouse Keeper
surface: A man turned off the light and went to bed. The next morning, he opened the window and committed suicide. Why?
bottom: He was a lighthouse keeper. He misjudged the time and turned off the lighthouse light. The next morning, he saw the shipwrecks and realized his mistake.

He turned off the lighthouse light
Turning off the light caused a shipwreck

title: Power Outage
surface: A woman saw that there were no lights in the window and knew her husband had died.
bottom: Her husband relied on medical equipment to stay alive. The woman saw that the lights were out and realized there had been a power outage, and her husband had died.

The woman saw there were no lights in the window
The power outage caused the life support equipment to fail
The husband died due to the power outage
The power outage meant the loss of her husband's life

title: Hand
surface: Every day when I wake up, there is a hand touching me. That hand is incredibly warm, until one day, a water droplet slid down my face, and that hand slowly turned cold.
bottom: I was born both blind and deaf, with touch being my only sense. My mother would touch my face every morning when I woke up. One day, a water droplet slid down my face, and that hand turned cold. Later, I learned that my mother had cancer and had not gone for treatment, taking care of me instead. That day, she could no longer hold on and passed away, leaving a tear on my face. She smiled at me and said, 'Live well.' After that, she gently touched me until her heart stopped.
tips: The narrator was born both blind and deaf
Touch was their only way of perceiving the world
The hand belonged to their mother
The mother had a terminal illness
The water drop was the mother's tear
The cold hand signified the mother's passing

title: Funeral
surface: When I was six, my dad took me back to the countryside for my great-grandfather's funeral. During the cremation, I said something that caused everyone to collapse.
bottom: When I was six, my great-grandfather passed away. We returned home, and everyone was grieving. I also saw my little brother, and we played hide and seek. As the funeral started, before I could find my brother, my dad pulled me to the grave, and everyone was crying. I suddenly saw my brother dancing in the fire and shouted, 'My brother is dancing in the fire!' Everyone collapsed in horror.
tips: The funeral was a cremation ceremony
The child’s words caused a breakdown
The child's words were about her brother
Her brother appeared in the fire during the cremation
The brother's situation was abnormal

title: Sister
surface: Guests came over to the house. Grandma was holding the younger sister, and the little girl was holding her sister's tiny hand. 'Your sister is so cute, like a doll!' Every time a guest praised her sister, the little girl was very happy! But soon after, both her sister and grandma died, and the little girl collapsed.
bottom: The little girl loved dolls, especially cutting off the limbs to play with them. At night, when the little girl was asleep, grandma would secretly sew the doll back together. The little girl thought dolls had 'self-healing abilities.' Her newborn sister had big eyes and looked very cute. Every time guests came over, they said the sister looked like a doll. The little girl then thought her sister also had 'self-healing abilities.' One day, when there were no adults at home, her sister died, and the little girl, along with the whole family, collapsed. Upon learning the reason, grandma felt guilty and committed suicide.
tips: The girl thought dolls could heal themselves
Grandma secretly sewed the broken dolls back together
Guests always said the sister looked like a doll
The girl hurt her sister as she did with the dolls
Grandma committed suicide due to guilt

title: Woman
surface: Xiao Mei was a student, and every day after school, she noticed a woman on the third floor across the street watching her. A few months later, Xiao Mei never saw the woman again.
bottom: The woman had hung herself three months ago. She was a single woman with few friends. The police broke in and found the broken rope.
tips: The woman across the street had been dead for a long time
Xiao Mei was not seeing a living person
The woman had hanged herself three months ago
The woman still watched Xiao Mei from the window after death
The police discovered her body after breaking in

title: Brother
surface: I love my brother. It’s so nice to have my brother with me. Why did my brother bite me? It hurts so much. It's great, we can be together forever.
bottom: My brother and I were still in our mother's womb. My brother was stronger and absorbed more nutrients, making me small and weak. Eventually, we became conjoined twins, sharing one body.

My brother absorbed more nutrients in the womb

title: Blind Disaster
surface: That day, a disaster struck, and I, along with everyone on Earth, became blind. Two years later, I suddenly regained my sight. Just as I was about to tell everyone, I saw that phrase. I clamped my mouth shut.
bottom: This disaster changed everything. In this world of blindness, the blind became the so-called 'normal people.' They formed a new government and secret organizations, secretly hunting down those who could see and using them for experiments. Over the next two years, some regained their sight, but under the new government’s rule, anyone who claimed to see was immediately captured.
tips: A global disaster caused humanity to become blind
The protagonist regained their sight after two years
The blind formed a new world order
Those who regained sight were secretly captured

title: Exit
surface: "I want to get out, it's so dark." "Don't worry, we'll find an exit." She got up and looked around, but saw nothing. Scared and angry, she shouted to her husband in the next room, "Come out!" The woman died.
bottom: The woman was pregnant and often woke up at night during her pregnancy, so her husband slept in the next room. In the middle of the night, the woman heard a strange sound. The sound was very close, as if it was coming from inside her body. The woman was scared and looked around, but there was nothing in the unobstructed room. So she loudly called out to her husband, telling him to come out. As soon as she spoke, she felt a sharp pain coming from beneath her. She finally understood whose voice it was.

The woman was pregnant
The shout was directed at the fetus in her womb (or the source of the internal noise)

title: Harvest
surface: The goat's carrots had a good harvest. Little White Rabbit died, and Little Black Rabbit was full.
bottom: The goat's carrots had a good harvest, and he wanted to share some with Little White Rabbit and Little Black Rabbit. Little Black Rabbit took the carrots and left, while Little White Rabbit said she didn't want carrots, only some seeds. The next year, Little White Rabbit starved to death before the carrots grew. Little Black Rabbit finished his own carrots, just in time for Little White Rabbit's field to have a good harvest, and he casually took it, making himself plump and black.

Little White Rabbit starved waiting for harvest

title: Globe
surface: Ivan loved globes very much. He saved money for half a year to buy a beautiful globe and played with it every day. But one day, when he heard a certain piece of news, he roared and threw the globe out the window. What happened?
bottom: The Soviet Union collapsed, and his proud motherland no longer existed, rendering the globe useless.

title: Big Client
surface: Ah Qiang, whose business was struggling, received a big order: Xiao Shuai wanted a set of artistic photos. To meet Xiao Shuai's various eccentric demands, Ah Qiang sometimes had to go to the rooftop, sometimes dive underwater, working himself half to death every day, challenging various high difficulties. Xiao Shuai provided all the photography scenes, costumes, and props, and also dictated the shooting angles. One day, Xiao Shuai didn't show up for the appointment. A few days later, Xiao Shuai's family brought the sad news that Xiao Shuai had passed away, but they didn't take any of his photos. After everyone left, Ah Qiang destroyed all of Xiao Shuai's photos.
bottom: The artistic photos Xiao Shuai was taking were actually posthumous portraits. He didn't know how he would die, so he simulated various death scenarios, some involving falling from a tall building, others drowning... In every photo, he posed with a smile, appearing in his best state. He wanted his posthumous photos to be presentable, announcing his death to friends and family at the funeral in a humorous way. However, Xiao Shuai died before the shoot was completed, and his death method was not depicted in any of the photos, so his family didn't take any of them, and Ah Qiang destroyed them.
tips: The true purpose of the photos was posthumous portraits
The photoshoot content simulated various death scenarios
The client died unexpectedly before the photoshoot was complete
The client's actual cause of death did not match any photo scenario
The photos were destroyed because they were unrelated to the actual death

title: Half a Matchstick
surface: A person was found dead in the desert, head down. Scattered nearby were several suitcases, and the person tightly clutched half a matchstick. Deduce how this person died?
bottom: This person and a friend were flying in a hot air balloon. The hot air balloon malfunctioned, and even after throwing out all the luggage, it was still a bit overweight. So they drew lots, and the one who drew the half matchstick was thrown out.
tips: Hot air balloon journey
Encountered an overweight crisis during the journey
Still overweight after throwing out luggage
Used matchsticks to draw lots for life or death
Died from falling from a great height

title: Green Light
surface: Xiao Mei was home alone late at night when the power suddenly went out. She found two columns of cursed text glowing green on her bookshelf. She screamed and rushed out of the house. That night, she stayed at her friend Xiao Hui's place. She remembered that another friend, Xiao Wen, had given her a gift that was originally in that spot on the bookshelf, and Xiao Wen had died unexpectedly shortly after giving the gift. Thinking of this, Xiao Mei became even more scared, but thankfully Xiao Hui was with her.
bottom: Xiao Wen was a prop maker. While making props, she found a very beautiful one, except that it had two columns of glowing cursed text on both sides, which could be used for horror films. So, she made an identical one, but changed the two columns of text to blessings. After finishing, she gave the blessed ornament to Xiao Mei. She didn't tell Xiao Mei about the glowing text, wanting to give her a surprise. A few days later, Xiao Wen died unexpectedly, but she never knew that she had given the wrong ornament.

Xiao Mei saw the words on the gift because of the power outage
Friend Xiao Wen was a prop maker
Xiao Wen gave the wrong gift
Friend Xiao Wen died unexpectedly

title: Coke

bottom: Yueyue and Xiao Ming were neighbors. One day while playing, Yueyue took a Coke from the kitchen and gave it to Xiao Ming. Xiao Ming didn't want it because he wasn't thirsty. As a result, Yueyue drank the whole bottle of Coke. Unexpectedly, the bottle of Coke was filled with Dichlorvos pesticide by her grandmother. Yueyue died before she could even reach the hospital.

Grandmother's mistake
Xiao Ming didn't drink the Coke because he wasn't thirsty

title: Expensive Price
surface: "Can it be cheaper?" "You get what you pay for." "My husband was bitten by a snake in the car; I wish it were cheaper." The woman cried to the doctor.
bottom: As the New Year approached, the wife was at the mall choosing a Year of the Snake gift for her husband. At the sales assistant's recommendation, she eventually bought an expensive green scarf. The husband was very happy when he received it and wore the new scarf while riding his electric bike to buy New Year's goods. On the way, the road became slippery due to ice, and he unfortunately tipped over. It was originally just a simple fall, but the scarf the husband was wearing accidentally got caught in the still rapidly rotating wheel. Because the scarf was expensive and of excellent quality, it didn't break, and the husband was strangled to death. The wife collapsed upon learning everything and went insane from intense self-blame, believing her husband was killed by a green snake. But her subconscious still blamed herself, so she kept repeating: "I wish it were cheaper."
tips: An expensive green scarf
The scarf got caught in the wheel and didn't break due to its high price and quality
The husband died in an electric bike accident
The wife suffered a mental breakdown
The wife believed the scarf was a snake

title: Two Lives, One Shot
surface: In a sealed room, there were two corpses, a deck of playing cards, a pistol, and a spent bullet. The corpse with a bullet hole in its head had a smile on its face, while the other's face was filled with pain.
bottom: This was a room on a shipwrecked boat. Two acquaintances played cards to compete for the right to use the pistol's last bullet to commit suicide. The loser would then drown when the water flooded in.
tips: Desperate situation on a sinking ship
Playing cards used to decide life or death
Competing for the right to the only bullet for suicide
The winner shot themselves (smiling)
The loser drowned (in pain)

title: Fog, Deceased Wife, Stranger
surface: The man was driving his pregnant wife on a road at night when the car broke down and a heavy fog rolled in. The man left his wife in the car and went to find help. When he returned, he found his wife dead in the car, and there was also a person in the car he didn't recognize.
bottom: His wife was pregnant and about to give birth. The man was driving her to the hospital. After the man got out of the car, his wife died in the car from a severe hemorrhage during difficult labor. The extra person was their newborn baby.
tips: Wife in active labor needing urgent medical attention
Car breakdown/heavy fog caused delay
Husband left to seek help
Wife died in the car during childbirth
The stranger is the newborn baby

title: No Survivors
surface: Went downstairs, someone was smashed to death. Went upstairs, someone was burned to death. Came home, and I was electrocuted to death.
bottom: The person upstairs was drinking on the balcony, which was lined with empty wine bottles. As dusk approached, the person upstairs was about to turn on the light when the switch malfunctioned and shocked him. He accidentally knocked an empty wine bottle off the balcony. He looked downstairs and thought, "Oh no, I've caused trouble." The person downstairs was hit in the back of the head and died instantly. The person upstairs quickly collected all the empty wine bottles. Just then, "I" happened to leave my house and saw the person downstairs lying on the ground with a broken wine bottle, realizing that something had been thrown from above, but looking up, I couldn't tell which apartment it came from. Actually, "I" was going downstairs to set off some fireworks, since it was New Year's. Even though someone died, "I" didn't plan to change my plans. Coincidentally, because it was too close to the residential building, the large fireworks "I" set off ignited flammable materials on the upstairs window sill. I felt a bad premonition and rushed upstairs to help put out the fire, but no matter how I knocked, the door wouldn't open. It turned out the person upstairs was already heavily drunk and couldn't be woken up. Helpless, "I" immediately called 119 and a locksmith. When the fire truck arrived, the fire was quickly brought under control, but the person upstairs had already suffocated. The person who was smashed to death was actually a frequent thief of ground wires, and today he had made a good haul, but unfortunately, he wouldn't see tomorrow's sun. Because the entire building's ground wires were stolen, the appliances in various households experienced varying degrees of leakage. The upstairs switch's leakage was also caused by the cut ground wire. "I" was wet all over from the water sprayed by the fire truck during the rescue. Returning home, "I" was careless and didn't dry my hands before using the electric kettle, and was electrocuted by the leaking casing of the kettle.
tips: Stolen ground wires caused a chain of electrical leaks
Electrical shock led to high-altitude projectile smashing the wire thief
Protagonist's fireworks accidentally ignited upstairs
Upstairs resident, drunk, suffocated in the fire
Protagonist got wet from firefighting, later died from electrical leakage

title: Letter
surface: Xiao Gang was driving on the road when his car suddenly went out of control and crashed into the roadside. Xiao Gang died on the spot. A letter was found in his car.
bottom: Xiao Gang was on his way to meet his beloved, preparing to confess his feelings and give her a love letter. But while driving, he received a message rejecting him. He became distracted and lost control of the car, ultimately leading to the tragedy, and the love letter was never delivered.
tips: Planned to confess in person and deliver a love letter
Received a rejection message en route
Rejection message caused distraction leading to car crash
Unsuccessful confession, love letter became a relic

title: Turn Off the Light
surface: I was home alone and forgot to turn off the light before going to bed. When I suddenly realized in the middle of the night that I had forgotten to turn off the light, I burst into tears.
bottom: My beloved had just passed away. He used to turn off the light for me every night before he died. The moment I realized I had forgotten to turn off the light, I suddenly became painfully aware that my beloved was truly gone, and no one would ever thoughtfully turn off the light for me again. Overwhelming grief and longing surged through me, making me burst into tears.
tips: The habit of turning off the light was associated with a loved one
Before his death, the loved one used to turn off the light for me when I forgot
Forgetting to turn off the light triggered the realization
The light being on symbolized the loved one's eternal absence
Seeing the light triggered deep sadness and longing, causing me to cry profusely

title: Lover
surface: A couple was deeply in love. One day, the girl told the boy she had a dream where she was in a dark place and couldn't find him. The boy comforted her. Soon after, the boy suddenly broke up with her, and the girl was very sad. Deduce the reason for the breakup.
bottom: The boy had a terminal illness and knew he didn't have much time left. He didn't want the girl to suffer more later, so he deliberately broke up with her, hoping she would hate him. This way, she could move on from the relationship faster and start a new life. The girl's dream made the boy feel it was a premonition, further solidifying his decision to break up.
tips: The boy has a terminal illness and limited time
The breakup is a selfless sacrifice for love
The dream is seen as a premonition of separation
The boy initiated the breakup to lessen future pain
Intentionally created hatred to facilitate forgetting

title: Obsession
surface: Time is almost up... Because of my obsession, she lost her mother forever.
bottom: My wife was one of the victims of a serial murder case, but the police were never able to track down the killer. With the statute of limitations almost expiring, nineteen years after the last crime, I had no choice but to imitate the killer's modus operandi, kill a woman, and dispose of her body to reset the statute of limitations so the police would continue their investigation. But when I saw that crying girl clutching her mother's corpse, an intense wave of guilt and remorse washed over me. Because of my obsession, I had shattered yet another family. What difference was there between me and that heinous murderer?
tips: The statute of limitations was about to expire
My wife and I were victims of the original serial case
I imitated the crime to extend the statute of limitations
Losing her mother refers to the daughter of the new victim
Imitating the murder caused intense guilt

title: Obey
surface: Mom held my body, crying out to me: 'How many times have I told you, you must look left and right when crossing the road, but why don't you ever listen?' I wish I could tell Mom: I did look, I really did.
bottom: I was born colorblind. Mom often told me: 'You must look left and right when crossing the road, and follow others.' One day, while waiting at a traffic light, I saw a man striding forward. I thought it was a green light and I could cross, so I followed the man. Unexpectedly, a truck came speeding towards us and knocked us both flying. Beside the man, a suicide note lay scattered.
tips: The narrator has a visual impairment and cannot accurately judge traffic signals.
The narrator's act of crossing the road was imitating another person.
The person being imitated was not crossing the road according to traffic rules at that time.
That person intentionally walked into dangerous traffic.
There was an item at the scene that could prove that person's intent (a suicide note).

title: Orange
surface: I took an orange from Grandma's room for Dad, but Dad was terrified.
bottom: Our family wasn't wealthy. Grandma loved me very much when she was alive. She bought me many oranges, which I loved. After Grandma passed away, Dad concealed the news of her death to continue receiving subsidies. I saw that the window in Grandma's room was open, and oranges hung all over the branches outside the window. I thought Grandma had sent them. Later I learned that even in her final moments, Grandma hadn't forgotten me; that orange tree symbolized her endless love and her presence with me.
tips: Grandma had actually passed away.
Dad concealed Grandma's death for a specific reason (e.g., for benefits).
The oranges were not normally stored in Grandma's room but came from a special source outside the room (an orange tree outside the window).
The child did not know Grandma had passed away and misunderstood the origin of the oranges.
Dad's fear was related to the appearance of the oranges and the possibility of his concealed secret being revealed.

title: Dark
surface: It was too dark, I turned on the light, but it got even darker.
bottom: I came home, it was too dark. I went to turn on the light. Because of a gas leak in the house, an explosion occurred the moment I turned on the light. I entered eternal darkness.
tips: The act of turning on the light directly triggered a catastrophic consequence.
Before the light was turned on, there was an invisible dangerous substance in the house (gas leak).
'Got even darker' does not refer to the room's light dimming but describes the narrator's final state.
The event caused permanent severe injury to the narrator.
The electric spark produced by turning on the light was the key factor triggering the disaster.

title: Hide-and-Seek
surface: Mom taught me to play hide-and-seek, the rules were different from when I played with friends. I won, Mom died.
bottom: I am 7 years old. My dad, mom, and I were once a happy family of three. But ever since Dad started drinking heavily, everything changed. He turned into a monster I didn't recognize. He started hitting Mom for no reason, each time beating her until she wouldn't move before he would stop. Once, after hitting Mom, he saw me crying loudly nearby. He raised his fist and walked towards me. Mom, seeing this, desperately crawled up and rushed over to hold his leg. Dad beat Mom again until she couldn't move, then went into the house. The next day, while Dad was away, I asked Mom: 'Mom, how can we stop Dad from hitting us? I don't want to see you get hit anymore, it hurts me so much...' Mom, with tears in her eyes, smiled and said: 'Sweetie, let's play hide-and-seek, okay? If you win, we won't be hit anymore. But this game is different from when you play with your friends. In this game, Dad and I are both looking for you. If I find you, you win. If Dad finds you, then you run downstairs quickly, don't let Dad catch you, okay?' 'Okay, Mom, I understand!' Another night, Dad came back drunk again. Unsurprisingly, he beat Mom again with fists and kicks. After a while, seeing Mom motionless, Dad went back to his room to rest. After Mom saw him go back, she carefully crawled over to me, curled up in a ball, and said: 'Sweetie, let's start playing hide-and-seek now.' I immediately got up and hid in the large wardrobe in my bedroom, not daring to make a sound. Through the crack in the door, I vaguely saw Mom holding a fruit knife, walking into Dad's bedroom. After a sound of fighting and things breaking, Mom staggered out slowly. Mom opened the wardrobe where I was hiding and said: 'Sweetie won, Dad will never hit us again, Mom will always love you...' After saying that, Mom collapsed, and bright red blood kept flowing from her neck. Mom closed her eyes forever... It turned out that when Mom was trying to kill Dad, Dad wasn't fast asleep. He was awakened by Mom's footsteps, saw Mom holding the knife, and started to struggle for it. During the struggle, Mom's hand holding the knife was grabbed by Dad, and it cut Mom's carotid artery. Blood gushed out continuously. At this moment, Dad was stunned, and Mom took this opportunity to stab the fruit knife into Dad's heart.
tips: This game of hide-and-seek was a plan designed by the mother to solve the problem of domestic violence.
The peculiarity of the game rules (e.g., Mom finding the child means winning) was to protect the child and execute the plan.
While the child was hiding, the mother took fatal action against the father.
The father also died during this 'game'.
The mother's cause of death was a fatal injury sustained during the struggle with the father.

title: Mother
surface: She raised me single-handedly, yet I caused her death, even though I wasn't there at the time.
bottom: Mother lost a hand in a work accident, and Father also abandoned us. When I grew up and earned money, I got Mother a prosthetic limb. With a glove on, Mother looked no different from a normal person. I took Mother mountain climbing. I was afraid she would get tired, so I let her take the cable car. I went up another path myself. The cable car malfunctioned, and Mother lost her balance and fell. Originally, the person with her could have saved her, but he grabbed her prosthetic limb, so the prosthesis quickly detached from her body, and Mother fell. If I hadn't given Mother the prosthetic limb, the person with her would have grabbed her other hand. So I feel like I caused Mother's death.
tips: The phrase 'raised me single-handedly' has a literal meaning in addition to its figurative one.
The mother had a physical disability (lost a hand).
The narrator once provided the mother with an item to compensate for her physical defect (a prosthetic limb).
The mother died in an accidental fall.
The item provided by the narrator, at the time of the accident, actually hindered effective rescue.

title: Perfect Crime
surface: He killed his lover with a pair of scissors, but there wasn't a single drop of blood at the scene.
bottom: His lover met with an accident and was declared brain dead after rescue attempts failed, only able to be kept alive by machines. He couldn't bear to watch his lover lying on the hospital bed, growing thinner day by day, yet never waking up again. So he decided to cut the machine's power cord with scissors, allowing his lover to pass away peacefully in the hospital. He killed his lover with a pair of scissors, but there wasn't a single drop of blood at the scene.
tips: Before being 'killed,' the lover was in a special state of existence (e.g., dependent on machines for life support).
The scissors were not used on the lover's body.
The act of 'killing' here refers to terminating the life support process.
There was no blood because no open physical wound was inflicted.
The man's motive was related to ending his lover's suffering.

title: If
surface: My head bumped, Father chattered endlessly, I kept laughing, a stranger pushed me, if only I had just slept.
bottom: After Father died, I dragged my tired body and brought wine to visit him at his grave. Glass after glass of wine went down my throat with tears. I rambled on for a long time. Exhausted, I leaned on the offering table in front of the grave, my head bumped down, and I fell asleep. In my dream, my head bumped against the steering wheel, Father was still by my side, chattering endlessly at me, I kept smiling foolishly. Great, so Father's death in a car accident was just a nightmare I had while I dozed off. In reality, Father was still by my side, great! Until dusk, when the cemetery was about to close, the groundskeeper pushed me while checking. Before my eyes was Father's tombstone. Overwhelming grief washed over me, 'If only Father's death was just a dream I had while sleeping.'
tips: The story's setting is related to the deceased father (cemetery).
The narrator had already experienced the father's death before the story began.
The scene where the father chatters and the narrator laughs did not happen in reality.
The narrator fell asleep midway through the story and had a dream.
The stranger's action interrupted the narrator's dream, bringing them back to reality.

title: Laughter
surface: I hid my hand behind my back, he smiled at me, but I couldn't hear, 'I'm sorry...'
bottom:
War raged. To move the still-living baby to a safe zone, one of my hands was blown off, a bloody mess. I didn't want to scare him, so I hid my hand behind my back. Seeing me like this, he seemed to think I would suddenly pull out candy or a toy for him, just like his parents would, and he actually grinned amidst the ruins.
I could imagine his laughter; it must be more beautiful than singing, definitely crisp, clean, and refreshing. Unfortunately, I couldn't hear it. Explosions were still going off in the distance; my ears had long gone deaf from the gunfire.
'I'm sorry... little baby, Auntie might not be able to pull out a little gift for you...'
I died.
tips: The narrator's hidden hand suffered severe physical trauma.
The story is set against a backdrop of violence and danger (e.g., war).
'He' who smiled at the narrator is a young child or baby.
The narrator's hearing loss was caused by external environmental factors.
The narrator's apology is related to being unable to fulfill a child's expectation (e.g., producing a gift).

title: Filial Piety
surface: Her leg was broken. One piece, two pieces, three pieces... One bowl, two bowls, three bowls... She died.
bottom: She was an elderly mother who broke her leg in an accident. Her son, already unable to support her, sent her to a 'jar grave' because she had completely lost her ability to work. The jar grave was made just large enough to hold the mother. The opening of the grave was not sealed. Each time the son brought a bowl of rice for his mother, he would add a brick to the grave opening. When there were enough bricks, the grave was completely sealed, and the mother starved to death.
tips: After her leg was broken, she was abandoned by her family.
The number of bricks and rice bowls records a gradual process towards death.
She was placed in a small, enclosed space specifically designed for waiting for death (jar grave).
The person who carried out this process and ultimately caused her death was her son.
Her direct cause of death was being sealed in that space and deprived of food.

title: Red is Destruction
surface: Red is destruction, blue is salvation, black is death.
bottom: A building caught fire. The fire burned everything. Firefighters used water to extinguish the fire, trying to save the trapped residents. Unfortunately, some residents were still choked to death by the black smoke.
tips: This event involves a common disaster whose primary destructive force is often visualized as red.
The means used for 'salvation' is a common liquid, usually considered blue.
The fatal factor represented by the color 'black' is produced by the 'red' process of destruction.
The event took place in a building.
Despite the 'blue' rescue efforts, 'black' still caused fatalities.

title: Old Man
surface: The old man ferried the man across the river. The man crossed the river, but the old man died in the river.
bottom: The man was a chivalrous thief who was wanted for killing a tyrannical king. The old man recognized him when he fled to the riverbank and took him across the river. He repeatedly urged the old man not to reveal his whereabouts. The old man then committed suicide to prove to him that he would never leak the secret.
tips: The man's identity was special; he was evading pursuit.
The old man knew the man's identity.
Before and after crossing the river, the man emphasized the importance of secrecy to the old man.
The old man's death was not an accident but his own choice.
The old man chose death to protect the man's secret.

title: Eating Meat
surface: Today I was weaned. My mother asked me to eat meat, but I didn't want to. Later, I had a younger brother, and my younger brother loved to eat meat. I died.
bottom: I was an abandoned baby, adopted by a she-wolf. After being weaned, wolf-mom fed me raw meat, but my teeth and stomach were not adapted to this kind of food. Later, wolf-mom gave birth to a wolf-brother. She no longer needed me to satisfy her excess maternal love, so she bit me to death and fed me to her wolf-brother.
tips: The 'mother' in the story is not human.
The 'meat' provided by the 'mother' might not be suitable for human consumption (e.g., raw meat).
The birth of the younger brother changed the 'mother's' attitude and needs towards the narrator.
The narrator's body eventually became a food source for the younger brother.
It was the 'mother' who directly caused the narrator's death.

title: Tap Three Times
surface: She tapped me, I couldn't hear anything. Once, twice. Before I could wait for the third tap, someone called the police.
bottom: My friend and I were playing hide-and-seek. The hider would cover their head once hidden, and the seeker had to tap the hider three times to indicate they were caught. I was hiding under a guardrail. He found me and tried to reach under to tap me, but his neck got stuck in the guardrail. He felt suffocated and flailed his arms, hitting me twice. But we had an agreement, so I didn't move, until a passerby noticed and quickly called the police.
tips: The narrator and the person tapping them were playing a game with specific rules.
The game rules required the person being tapped to remain still until the specified process (being tapped three times) was completed.
The tapping action was an important part of the game, needing to be completed a specific number of times (three times).
The tapper failed to complete the required number of taps because they themselves encountered an accident.
The police were called because the tapper was in a life-threatening situation.

title: Three Phone Calls
surface: You received a third call from the teacher, telling you not to go to school anymore. You burst into tears while booking a train ticket.
bottom: You are a migrant worker who left your child in your hometown. Your child, due to excellent grades, was bullied at school. Afraid of worrying her parents, she decided to hide it. To fit in, she started not doing homework, skipping classes, and deliberately answering questions incorrectly. The volunteer teacher discovered this situation and called you, but you couldn't return home. Even though the child did this, the situation didn't improve; she was still bullied by classmates, and it got worse. The child started self-harming, hoping to get your attention. The teacher called you again, and you still didn't go home. Finally, one day, the child jumped from the school building, ending her own life. You finally have to go home, to see your child one last time.
tips: The first two calls from the teacher were also related to serious problems the child encountered at school.
The child was experiencing something very painful at school (e.g., bullying, exclusion).
The narrator (you) was unable to immediately return to the child's side due to work or geographical location.
The reason the teacher said 'don't go to school anymore' was because the worst, irreversible situation had happened to the child.
The train ticket was booked to go back and deal with the tragic event involving the child.

title: The Timid One
surface: The timid him was so engrossed in a certain matter that he could not face death peacefully.
bottom: He was a king. Because at that time it was prevalent for assassins to poison kings. He was very afraid of being poisoned himself, so he adopted a method of fighting poison with poison. That is, he drank poison every day, starting with a mild toxicity, and then increasing it day by day, to make himself resistant to poison. But one day his castle was surrounded by enemies. Unable to escape, he thought it better to commit suicide than to be executed by the enemy. He originally wanted to drink poison to commit suicide, thinking it would be less painful, but his resistance to poison made it impossible for him to die. So after drinking the poison, he had to order his soldiers to kill him with swords.
tips: His status made him an easy target for assassination.
The matter he was 'engrossed' in was to prevent a specific type of death (poisoning).
He had been systematically exposing himself to a lethal substance over a long period to build resistance.
He ultimately chose death to avoid a worse fate at the hands of his enemies.
The efforts he had made in the past to save his life ironically prevented him from choosing a 'peaceful' way to die.
